content.detailedDescription:
I am sorry but i am rely freaked out right now, just called some friends in wentsville md they saw the same thing, i have the corse of the object call me if you want, i filmed it it flew right over my head.

dling the film now..
content.summary: I am sorry but i am really freaked out right now,  just called some friends in wentsville md they saw.

content.detailedDescription:
Ok, so this just happened to me an hour ago. i was taking a walk on my street and i was down by my local legion when i noticed a really bright light up over the hill in the woods,  it looked like a white street light. i immediately went towords it and noticed that it was farther away then i thought and it wasnt a street light.    then i thought it had something to do with the airport being neear by so i watched ,  it didnt seem like it was moving it seemed like it was searching, then all of a sudden the light just dropped into the woods and went out.    then i knew it was a ufo. 
 so after i seen it land i started to run home and im running up my street which was towords where i seen it land and there again in the sky between some houses there it is again. immediattley i run across the lawns and into an open spot on a hill to get a better look and im focusing on it. the bright light  is dimming  and is accompanied by two smaller red lights that could be seperate or part of the same object, they seem to tilt around a bit as they drop into the woods and vanish.
content.summary: Bright light dims then lands.

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 11:00 pm on july 2, 2010, i stepped outside and decided to look up at the stars, but i looked over to the east-northeast and saw a red light off in the distance just above the horizon, it was not flashing, it was hovering just above the horizon, then it disappeared, i also noticed that the light on the cell phone tower about a mile to our east was not flashing, so either that was a coincidence or the ufo had an effect on the flashing cell phone tower light. the next day (july 3rd) at about 9:30 pm me and my cousin were riding our bicycles down our road, as we were riding, we were facing east, when we noticed the same exact light, and the cell phone tower light was not flashing. but we came up to a turn, and the corn blocked the view so we could not see it anymore. later that night, my cousin had gone home, but it was about 11:00 pm that same night, and me and my parents decided to go outside and look around for anything unusual, this time i had my camera in my hands and ready to go. thats when we could see the light re-appear to the east again, i immediately turned on the camera and tried to take the best photos of it as i could, then i switched the camera into video mode, and shot some video of it and i was able to capture the object disappear on video. the camera we have tends to not take very good photos of objects up close, they usually get blurry, but i still have that image just incase i need it (i still have the video too). the photo has two lights, the red light is the ufo, the green light is a light at someones house.
content.summary: Red light appears from july 2-3, 2010, comes on for 10 seconds and goes off for 30 mintutes.

content.detailedDescription:
my wife , step son and i were outside in the driveway lighting some fireworks enjoying the evening of the forth at home.
during a break in between lighting various fireworks my wife says "look! what is that?"
 i immediatly looked up and seen a huge orange ball moving extreamly slow, almost a hover, or drift. this object was not flaming but appeared to be almost a moltent like, or lava color..... i guess that would be the best way to describe the light form that it was emitting.

 we all stared at the object and watched it for a few minutes as it drifted "southeast ward i beleive" it was headed toward the michigan / indiana boarder, or near the town of new buffalo, mich.
 
the object was big at first. so much so that we thought it was an airplane on fire."but no flames".... just orange like lava or a huge smolder.
 
we watched and watched as it drifted away and got smaller.

it was moving sideways across the sky from left to right. it did not travel in a straight line  the object went up and down a little bit.
it slowly became smaller as it moved away. 
 from start to finish it went from about the size of an upclose aircraft on fire and we watched it drift and become smaller, and smaller to the size of a penny coin and then smaller to nothing.

 we all stood dumbfounded and kept asking eachother what was that? tossed around ideas, but nothing could explain it. it was not fire works and we were not drinking. the neighbors were outside they may have also seen it. we havent yet asked them. 
 we came in the house and called the michigan city police department and expressed our concern and also asked if they had any reports of an aircraft on fire. they said it was not a plane and thats about it. we do not feel as if the call was taken as seriously as it should have been.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Slow moving object. as big an an aircraft on fire. "not fireworks!!!!!"

content.detailedDescription:
While watching neighborhood fireworks, my children came running up to the group and said they are watching a "falling star". we walked around the side of the house to investigate what we assumed were fireworks, and to our surprise, we watched a luminescent orange sphere low in the sky, coming from the east and then heading north across the sky. the object was moving quickly in what appeared to be a straight line, covering miles. there were no blinking lights that would identify it as a plane or helicopter, and there was no sound emanating from the object. it pulsed bright orange and then the light went out. it then came back on again, and then went out suddenly. we were very surprised because we knew it wasn't a plane or fireworks. 

about 30 minutes later, the same light appeared around the general location where we first spotted it, and it followed a straight line again across the sky. it was still a bright orange color, and once again made no sound. the lights were larger than those on a plane. it traveled across the sky and once again disappeared from view. it was not following the typical plane flight patterns that go over our neighborhood.
content.summary: Luminescent orange sphere that flew in a straight line, pulsed out, pulsed on, disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Me,my wife and kid were driving back from a picinic when i noticed ten people standing out of saucon valley grill pointing in the sky. figuring they were lookin @ fireworks so i looked up to. i saw no fireworks but i saw 3 orb like fireballs in a triangle shape in the sky. i was curious(naturally) so i drove faster to a nearby parking lot were i pulled over so we could get out to figure out what they were.Once we pulled over we saw two more flying overhead. they were about the size of a quarter and there was also a plane in the sky(alittle higher than the orbs).They seemed to flicker alittle but had no trails behind them. we watched them go over the mountain and out of sight. i then called my mother who lives kinda in the direction they appeared to be traveling to tell her to look for them. around 11pm when i got home i acually called the bar that i saw the people looking into the sky to ask them if they saw them too. the bartender told me that they saw the same thing i saw and one hovering over the houses too. i've always wanted to see something like this but everytime i think i see something i can disclaim it quickly. not the case with this sighting. definately something i can not explain.
content.summary: Fireballs moving through sky but they had no trails behind them.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were at the quakertown fireworks, sitting in a soccer field. just after the fireworks ended,approx.9:56 pm, we noticed a brightly lit orange object just to our east. it was at 1000 to 1500 feet, traveling initially in a nne direction, then heading more easterly, and moving at roughly 100 knots,however...It's speed seemed to vary somewhat. we watched until this vanished from our [clear] view into our ene. 
approx. 4 minutes later as we were walking nw to leave the fields, we saw two more of the same type of objects coming from the w. and heading e. these objects passed us to our n not more than 1 to 1 1/2 miles. our view was completely unobstructed. the first of these two objects appeared to be identical to the previous that we had seen. the next object behind, and following it,was clearly yellower, but otherwise the same. they also moved at the same speed and altitude as the first, but in a completely different direction. we watched these as they disappeared to our e.....Just like the first.
it was absolutely clear out, we had a perfect view, and these things were very close. i thought the only possible common explanation might be lanterns.......However..They moved much faster than than the prevailing breeze....0-5knots at ground.....And collectively, they were moving in different directions. also......No nav lights.....No anti-collision lights...No sound...And they appeared to be the same color and brightness from all of the angles that we viewed them...As if the were eminating light from the entire surface.
i am an experienced ocean sailor, flight enthusiast, and have worked outdoors for 30 years. i have no explanation for what we saw.
content.summary: Low orange bright objects. one moving sw to ne followed by two moving w to e.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife, 5 year old daughter and myself parked the truck on top of the highest hill on the golfcourse which overlooks the toms river to get a good view of the fireworks display that was scheduled to start shortly after 9:00 pm est ... we set our lawn chairs up on the grass facing south towards the river where tens of thousands, if not 100 or more thousand people lined the river shores from surrounding towns to watch the beachwood nj fireworks display. both sides of the river banks were packed with people from all over, as was the river itself jam packed with boaters waiting for the show to start. all of the surrounding roadways were jammed with traffic and cars parked on shoulders and people walking the streets to find a view of one of new jerseys premier fireworks displays.
the sky was just getting dark with just a hint of lightness still glowing from the west where the sun had gone down below the horizon. as we sat facing south on our chairs, i looked up to my right towards the western sky , a very bright star was shining on the horizon due west .. and then they appeared. as i was looking at the bright star , suddenly out of the western skies came a brilliant orange glowing craft , i say craft because it was obvious that this thing was flying or being propelled thru the sky on a straight and level path of flight... it was not a shooting star or a meteorite, i've seen them before and this was definitely not one of those. i immediately focused my eyes in on it because it was the most brilliant orange glowing color i have ever seen , more brilliant than words can describe , imagine the most brilliant intense orange glow on a darkening sky and moving like an airplane across the sky .. not really fast, just a steady rate of speed ... but it had no white headlights or red or green strobe lights ... it was not really as high up as commercial airliners fly ... it was relatively low as it traveled almost directly over us from south-west to north-east. it was huge , it had no wings , it appeared to be cone shaped where the leading point was smaller than the back , it could have been triangular , but it was surrounded by this brilliant glowing orange that made it hard to distinguish its exact shape ... as it was slowly coming towards us in the sky i stood up and said "look at that ... what is that?" ... my wife and daughter looked to the sky and got up out of their chairs .. just then a second object appeared in the sky from the western skies , an exact duplicate of the first one ... on the same flight path like it was following the first craft at the same altitude and same rate of speed .. but these things were not of this world , they were nothing resembling anything i have ever seen in the skies ... they still hadn't passed over us yet, they were coming closer though after watching them cross the wide expanse of western skies from my excellent wide open view ... i knew they would pass over us pretty closely so i ran over to my truck and reached under the seat for my high-powered binoculars ... i grabbed them and ran the 10 yards back to my wifes side and and put the binoculars up to my eyes just as the objects were passing overhead at their closest mark .. i focused the glasses in and looked and studied the craft very clearly for a good 20 seconds before handing the glasses over to my wife for her to get a look ...  she then handed them back and i studied the craft as the continued across the open sky into the north-east and out of view.
we both agreed afterwards that those two objects were not aircraft and they were not meteors or shooting stars. what we had both seen clearly thru the binoculars were two identical craft under some form of propulsion traveling across the sky , one following the other at the same altitude and rate of speed .. the altitude was probably between 10 and 15 thousand feet , lower than commercial airliners for sure , they made no noise as they passed overhead .. completely silent ... thru the binoculars you could really see upclose and clear ... picture an object the size of the space shuttle cruising over your head not really too far up .. it had that shape and size ... almost a wedge shape , or triangular pointed leading edge and a wide back-side ... and it was glowing a bright orange and you could almost make out flames coming from it , not just from the back of it ... from the entire thing ... the whole object was surrounded and enveloped in these brilliant intense orange flames .. both objects exactly the same ... one trailing the other by about a mile or two .... both looking as big as a low-flying space shuttle totally ablaze and wrapped in glowing orange flames ... but just cruising across the sky as though they were being controlled by someone or something ... clearly on a flight path heading somewhere and under control ... totally silent.
later we saw huge military aircraft coming overhead , easily distinguished with bright white headlights, flashing strobes on both wings , lous enormous engines ..As they flew over. even the commercial airliners flying 20-30 thousand feet overhead could be heard .. and their flashing strobes could be seen. but the two objects we saw were much lower and were totally silent ... with all the people watching the sky that night waiting for the fireworks , i'm hoping someone got to take some pictures. lets see if anyone else comes forward with a picture.
content.summary: Two spectacular brilliant-orange, enormous, enflamed looking objects crossed sky in front of thousands of spectators waiting for the fireworks display to start.

content.detailedDescription: my wife and myself were enjoying the fireworks when i noticed a amber light moving evenly across the night sky toward us.The light was pulsing slowly from not to bright to dim.There was no sound from this light source that i could here over the fire works.This light seemed to be larger than a private plane ,moving southeast approaching town then turned left to the north,then it picked up speed and out of sight from large to nothing in 2 seconds.
content.summary: Amber in color, bright to dim no sound, moving fast then very fast no strobes.

content.detailedDescription:
A bright moving object, in a straight trajectory, moving about as fast as a plane on the night sky, no flashing lights, no position lights, no white headlights, just a strange orange halo that did not change much as object flew overhead, from n-nw to s-se towards long island sound.
visible flight-over time from my standpoint about 30 sec. viewed from downtown fairfield, ct.
there must be many viewings from other people, since it was about 40 minutes after the 4th of july fire works had ended and people were walking home.
content.summary: Silent straight moving light with orange halo.

content.detailedDescription: While setting in theswing overlooking old hickory lake i notice objects droppingdown from the sky unlike aircraft or fireworks and im sure other reports will back this up they were following an irrugularflight path when they blink they seemed tojump great distance the paths of the six craft i observed dropped down fromthe sky with great brilliance in a blood red color and went north east for severalminutes then as u can tell shot at great speed into space please relay all video of this event to utube this was a real sighting  and not a hoax look for any reports or video of ufos out of nashville tn 4 july 9 pm for verification thank you very much out
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.shape: Circle,   Egg,   Fireball,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Dropping down 6 objects buzzed nashville.

content.detailedDescription: Family members and i were on vacation on carolina beach. we were on the beach in the evening ,and noticed this orange light out over the ocean.The light would appear ,and go out come back then two or three would appear after approximately twenty minutes the sphere broke off into nine or ten different spheres.The spheres all vanished ,and we didnt see anything else.This event was seen by six adults and four children.We were all amazed and had never seen anything like it.We thought we were the only ones who had seen these lights before a family friend told us about the reports at mufon.We tried to take pictures but no luck
content.summary: Family members seen orange sphere out from carolina beach.

content.detailedDescription: I went outside to watch my nieghbors setting off fireworks and saw a slow moving object about two miles in sky moving south to north above the gulf of mexico. it looked like a cluster of red and yellow stars but appeared to be one object with many parts in the general shape of a ball. i am an amature astronomer so i know it was not a star and it was not any type of commercial fireworks as we have none in our town. too high to be any homemade fireworks. it just moved slowly and up and down for four or five minutes then was gone.
content.summary: Slow moving object.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting in the park approx. 9:45pm before the fireworks started.  my brother noticed a orange sphere and wondered what it was.  our whole family then started watching it.  it was moving slowly in the sky and then approx. 30 seconds later we see another one appear next to it.  we were all staring to see if we could find out what it was.  they moved slowly for about another minute and then just vanished.
content.summary: 2 orange spheres over chautauqua lake.

content.detailedDescription: At first i thought i was looking at a radio tower as the object grew closer i ruled this out,the closer the object came i was more curious as i have never seen anything like this before in the sky the light patterns and color were also unfamilar to me, the object had all red lights which would flash 1-2-1-2 and all five would light up at once. the object from the sort of looked like a cross as i passed the object the side view looked different then from observing it head on viewing the pictures it appeared to have a different shape upon driving passed the object. overall i would say the event made me feel nervous.
content.summary: Stopped at a red light i noticed a series of flashing lights in the distance

content.detailedDescription: So a week prior to my sighting, there was another sighting by my friends in almost the exact same place above our house. there were multiple witnesses to the first sighting that i did not see. so on july 1st at approximately 4 p.M. i stepped outside my house to smoke a cigarette. i was actually thinking about the sighting my friends had the week before and started to look around in the skies. i spotted something almost directly overhead and starred at it for a few seconds and grew excited. i screamed for my friend who lives next door to come out and take a look because he had seen this the week before. i asked him if this is what he and the others had seen the week before. he said yes very excitedly that i was seeing it. as we stared at the object we noticed a similar object move in from behind it. the second one began circling around the first. i asked my friend for his binoculars so i could get a better look. it was totally frustrating because i could not find the objects through the glasses even though my friend was able to. these are cheap glasses with no adjustable range. my friend stated to me what we were seeing 2 sphere like objects with one seemingly dancing around the other one. at this point we probably had been watching the objects for about 15 minutes. my friend walked away for a moment and to me what appeared to be a cigar shaped object appeared. the 2 spheres seemed to be following it. after looking up for another minute or 2 the objects just simply vanished. i have no idea what we saw but i can tell you without a doubt this was not an airplane or helicopter. i know you hear about single eyewitness accounts but to have so many people see the same thing at the same time, there has to be something to it. i also took pictures of the objects but they were so high up i am not sure if you be able to see the objects or not. this is very very exciting to me. i was so bummed that i wasn't around the week before to share the encounter with my friends. the objects they saw were in gthe skies for over 2 hours in the same place.
content.summary: We saw 2 hovering spheres above our house in daylight followed by a cigar.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting in the living room with my mother when my dad rushed through the front door and told us to come outside and hurry. when we came out my dad pointed to the object. it was three orange lights the size of stars in the sky. it was way too big across to be an airplane and it wasn't making any noise. it was hard to tell if it was three seperate objects or one big object; although the lights seemed to move across the sky in perfect unison. the object was on the horizon moving south to north. it was moving at about the speed of an airplane. i only saw it for about a minute before a neighbors tree blocked our view of it. then i saw one light appear before the rest of the object was blocked by clouds on the horizon. it may have been chinese laterns but that doesn't explain how they were moving in perfect unsion. the object stuck to the same flight direction until it disapeared. i thought about reporting it to the police but i figured it would sound kind of stupid to call a police station the day before the 4th of july saying, "hey, there's some weird lights in the sky!"
content.summary: It was three lights in the shape of a triangle moving slowly across the sky.

content.detailedDescription: At 8:45 pm on july 30, 2009, my then 5 year old daughter witnessed a large red rectangular ufo from her bedroom window.  she is very observant and noticed it immediately as it came in to view.  my daughter quickly sketched the object and described it as a large glowing red rectangle.  the object moved quickly from the north, moving south to the horizon, just east of the crescent moon.  she said it "disappeared" as it moved behind a large tree across the street.  the incident happened so quickly that by the time she had alerted me the object was already gone.  though she was only 5 at the time my daughter is precocious and scientifically minded.  i asked her if she "really" saw it and she said she did--she does not fib to me and knows the difference between reality and a "fooly".
content.summary: Red rectangular ufo.

content.detailedDescription: I was returning from town and noticed a shiny object that kept flying (circuling )in and out of a wispy white cloud. it was gold and then silver reflecting the sunlight from the afternoon sun.  this lasted about 5 minutes in all. i do not think it was an aircraft because the craft was making to tight of a circle in and out of this cloud.     i was on route 51 going south  about 5 miles out side of town. there was no trafic. i slowed so i could observe the cloud and the shiny disk more clearly. the road has overhanging trees and i would loose sight of the cloud and disk ocasionally. the disc was about the size of a pencil eracer. on a straight of way i first noticed the activity, all i had to do was lift my eyes just a degree or two to see the reflection of the alternating gold or silver or sometimes half gold(on bottom)  and silver (on top).. at first i thought the reflection might have been from an airplane but this object was circuling to tightly to be an aircraft going through this perticular cloud. the cloud was not a large one but seemed to be surrounding the object or the object was staying close to the cloud for concelment. the cloud was white with gray tones in the center and was wispy on the outer edges.The object only came out of the cloud once that was when it was silver and gold together. it was almost as if it were observing me or something else. i was curious and would speed up to get to a location where i could see the cloud and disc again. before i got to the final straight of way on my way home i lost sight of the object. the cloud seemed to be there but i never saw the object again. to *(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms) case # 24127 i have seen a saucer shape exactly like yours out of my living room window back in january or feburar this year.It was on a cloudy stormy day also.
content.summary: While returning from town i noticed a shiny object in the sky circuling through wispy white clouds in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving east on the 2700 block of william penn highway in palmer township. about a mile away from the light at 25th and william penn i noticed 10-15 orange spheres that appeared to be hovering some distance above the easton hospital sign.  they almost appeared to be radio tower lights on top of a mountain, as they were arranged in two triangular formations, something almost like a hill line. but as i am familiar with the area i knew there is no mountain or anything taller than the sign on the hospital in that direction.  as i stopped at the light, i noticed that they were actually moving, fairly rapidly.  i made the turn onto 25th st north at this time and tried to keep visual contact with them. as i looped back around i could not find the formation anywhere in the sky.  a rough description of the formation is attached.  also immediately after noticing these i posted to facebook, and friends of mine have confirmed the sighting.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange spheres over easton.

content.detailedDescription:
*wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms was driving in to her job as a home health aide and saw what she thought was a hole in the storm clouds, she had her cell phone with her and took a picture of the hole in the clouds. when she got to her job, she told **name deleted--sgonzalez/cms  that she had seen a strange hole in the storm clouds on the way into work. he downloaded the picture on to his pc and saw the patterns of lights on the object, the trailing disturbance in the clouds and called me up on the phone. he sent the picture to me for my opinion.

to me, i can see the rain drops on the windshield and the image on the other side of the drops, there is no reflection in the glass.  

i have all the contact information for *wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms.
content.summary: Picture taken by cell while driving jeep at 55 mph.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking in the bournemouth square park, around 10:30 pm, walking in the direction of the beach. suddenly i looked at the sky, and i saw a way shining orange light; i kept looking at it, and then two more of these lights appeared, forming like a real big triangle in the sky. i tried to picture it with my sony cybershot camera, but the lights didn`t appear in the picture, they were still in the sky, but they didnt appear in the picture. then the two lights who came later suddenly disappeared, they didnt fly away, they just dissapeared. the other light stayed there fore few seconds more, then it just disappeared like the others. the park was kind of busy, but nobody would seem to notice these lights. when i noticed what i was seeing, i didn`t get really frightened, because it was like, not so close to me, but my stomach started turning around, and i started feeling different, strange, inquiet, because i just didnt expect to see such an object. after i saw it, i tried looking at the sky for some more time, to see if it would come again, but it didnt. i really need to explain that it was not  a giant triangle like the ones the ufo hunters show on tv, it was way different. much bigger, and it would not make any moves, just appeared and disappeares, like if tne light were turned off.
content.summary: Different giant triangle in bournemouth sky.

content.detailedDescription:
To the individuals that came by my home the other night, thank you for allowing me to know.  i am writing this to make a request that one or some of you help in gulf coast effort in any way that you can. thanks for changing my life and line of thought. i hope for you and your kind longevity and good life and the ability to find what you seek.  thanks again.

i also request that you not allow my grandchildren to see you again if that's possible.
content.summary: Know that you are monitoring this site.

content.detailedDescription:
*wit's identifying info deleted--sgonzalez/cms. myself and my partner were patroling in the same car when in the eastern sky i noticed the object which appeared to be stationary approx. 30 degrees above the horizon.  at first i thought it may be a local medivac helicopter which is stationed in our city.  also there were several fireworks being set off in the area.  after pointing it out to my partner, we stopped and observed.  after a few moments it started moving toward us slowly traveling east to west.   it then turned and began heading north at an upward angle.  as we began following it i got my cell phone and tried to capture video.  at this point it was already to far away to be caught on camera.  it continued on a northern course, picked up speed and altitude then very quickly disapeared.  it never changed color and no sound was heard coming from it.  there was no becon lights and no hard structure to the object.  it almost looked like an oriental paper balloon with fire flickering inside it.  however, it was far to large and accelerated extremely fast.  
at the time of this report, i am not aware of anyone else seeing it although, several people were outside during that time.

hopes you find this report helpful.

**wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms.
content.summary: Orange in color, flicking as if one fire, but with sphere shape, moving.

content.detailedDescription:
We were sat outside in the garden enjoying the evening air when i happened to look up to the sky . i saw a large star shaped orange glowing object, glide acrosss the sky then dissapear as quickly a it came.
i was thrilled to see the ufo, as i have previously witnessed the silver disc object that some people saw in south devon in 1994.The thing that struck me about the ufo was that it was the most beautiul, bright burnt orange colour.
we did have a camera with us, but as it was brand  new we werent sure how to video the ufo. hopefully someone else saw it ad would have taped it.
content.summary: Beautiful bright orange star shaped ufo glides across the sky then just dissapeared.

content.detailedDescription: Today my father and i witnessed a ufo. we were sitting on our deck facing north around 5 pm. we were discussing contrails as we watched a few planes fly above us. we noticed that some of planes did not have contrails and some of them did so we tried to understand the science behind this. immediately after this conversation a plane flew above us which had a contrail. the plane and the contrail looked normal to us, i believe the plane was a commercial jet, maybe a 747.  there was what looked like a white circle shaped flying object at the end of the contrail and we both noticed it right away. the contrail dispersed but the object remained and stayed stationary for the duration of the sighting which lasted a minute and a half. it was almost a clear day with a few clouds here and there and the sun was still out. the object appeared to be as high as the plane and we did not notice it until the plane flew overhead. the object could have been there prior to the arrival of the plane but it is uncertain when exactly it was visible. it had a defined shape to it and it appeared to be very small because it was so high up. it is important to note that it was very windy with clouds passing above us very quickly. i lost sight of the object when i went to tell the rest of my family what we were witnessing. i could not find the object again but my father says it remained still before disappearing.
content.summary: White object in sky.

content.detailedDescription: First sight was a  blue line in the sky.It was very fast at third site beacause it would hide then come back.In the shape was in a triangle shape but without one side and on missing side there was one blue orb.When it would fly to the left it would be in the blue shape i justy menssioned,then when it went right it was the same color on it and had two red orbs on each side.Far off the side it turned red and went right and wouldnt do anything.But when it came left it would be doing tricks and circleing around one star in the sky.This ufo was not related in being an unidentified flying object not alien realated.It was an ufo a;ien realated and this was not a plane.It would go realy fast to the right when it was hedding to the right with the to red orbs one under it and one above it.I named it the blue flyer beacause it was blue and flying,somtimes it would com in from the left not the right.This is the first ufo ive every seen in my life.
content.summary: Fast moving bright blue lit triangluar flying object.

content.detailedDescription: On saturday night of saturday july 3, 2010 starting at about 9:20 p.M. cst several of us observed orange glowing balls moving in formations of two and three. as the first group disappeared, another group would follow in about five minutes. they appeared to be following the lake michigan shoreline from south to north and then gaining altitude and turning out over the lake to the northeast.  there must have been twelve in all.  while they appeared to be about a mile east of our position and about 2,000 feet up, we did not hear engine noise.  they appeared to be floating until one gained on the other's position in the first group.
content.summary: Slow moving orange balls over the lake michigan shoreline at sheboygan, wi.

content.detailedDescription:
Incident still in progress!! film footage taken, 4 craft spoted below 10,000 ft north of lincoln, ne. multipul witnesses> will follow up with report. please contact asap. 

this is not a joke or prank, please respond!
content.summary: Two waves as of 23:30 hrs.

content.detailedDescription: My wife saw them first, she brought them to my attention. five red spheres 3 by 2 in formation followed by a 1/3 larger sphere bright yellow, followed by two more red ones.  a few minutes later a lone red sphere followed by itself.  they came from the northeast and turned more than 90 degrees back to the east. no sound.  could not tell how high or how far away.  not airplanes, helicopters, fireworks or flares.  brightness was constant.  saw them from my back yard.  after turning east they disappeared out of sight.
content.summary: 8 red spheres. five in formation 3 by 2 followed by 1/3 larger bright yellow sphere followed by two more another followed a few minutes later by itself.
